lead_paragraph: Researchers found that, over the long term, immigration had no negative effects on the wages and jobs of native-born workers.

headline.print_headline: Americans Aren’t Being Squeezed Out of Jobs by Immigrants, Report Finds
headline.main: Immigrants Aren’t Taking Americans’ Jobs, New Study Finds

snippet: Researchers found that, over the long term, immigration had no negative effects on the wages and jobs of native-born workers....
abstract: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine reports immigrants are integral to economic growth in America because they bring new ideas, create new businesses and add to labor force; study says there is no indication they are taking jobs from natives, but did not focus on displacement of American tech workers by immigrants with temporary visas.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine
